div.l: And seide his tale as ye shulle after here
Here endeth the cookes Prologe.
And begynneth his tale.
A Prentes whilom dwelt in oure Cite
Of Craft of vitaillers was he
A gaylard he was he was as goldefinych in the shawe
Broun as a bery a propre felowe
Wᵗith lockes I kembede fulle fetously
Daunce he coude welle and iolyly
Than he was cleped perkyn Reuelour͗e
He was as fulle of loue and paramour͗e
As is the hyve fulle of hony swete
Welle was the wenche that wᵗith hym myght slepe
And at euery brydale wold he synge and hoppe
He louede bettir the nethir end than the shoppe
For when there eny rydynge was in s s chepe
Out of the shop thedir wold he lepe
Tille that he had alle the sight I seyne
And dauncede welle he wold not come ayen
And gadred hym a meyny of his sorte
To hoppe and synge and make suche disport
And there they sett steuene for to mete
To pley at the dyse in suche a strete
For in the toun was there no prentise
That feirer coude cast a peir of dyse
Than perkyn coude and therto he was fre
Of his dispence in place of pryuyte
That founde his maister wel in his chaffare
For ofte tyme he fonde his box fulle bare
For shortly a prentyse that is a Reueloure
That haunteth dyse Ryet and ꝑparamoure
His maister shal hit in his shop a bye
Alle haue he no part of the mynstralsye
For thefte and ryot they be conuertibylle
